item.title: TypeScript Tops New JetBrains 'Language Promise Index'
item.description: In its latest annual developer ecosystem report, JetBrains introduced a new "Language Promise Index" topped by Microsoft's TypeScript programming language.

item.title: OpenSilver 3.1 Unveils Drag-and-Drop XAML Designer for VS Code
item.description: Claiming an industry first, Userware announced a drag-and-drop XAML designer for use in VS Code, coming with OpenSilver 3.1, the latest iteration of the open-source implementation of Microsoft's long-deprecated and oft-mourned rich client development platform, Silverlight.

item.title: Visual Studio Dev Vexed by Copilot's Obtuse 'Responsible AI' Refusal
item.description: No matter what, some systems simply won't divulge exactly what in the current conversation caused them to balk, simply pointing to vague policies and generic guidance.

item.title: On Blazor Component Reusability - From Day 0
item.description: "We want to try to design from Day One, even Day Zero, with reusability in mind," says Blazor expert Allen Conway in imparting his expertise to an audience of hundreds in an online tech event on Tuesday.

item.title: Visual Studio's AI Future: Copilot .NET Upgrades and More
item.description: At this week's Microsoft Ignite conference, the Visual Studio team showed off a future AI-powered IDE that will leverage GitHub Copilot for legacy app .NET upgrades, along with several more cutting-edge features.

item.title: PowerShell Gets AI-ified in 'AI Shell' Preview
item.description: Eschewing the term "Copilot," Microsoft introduced a new AI-powered tool for PowerShell called "AI Shell," available in preview.

item.title: GitHub Research Claims Copilot Code Quality Gains in Addition to Productivity
item.description: GitHub says new research proves its Copilot AI tool can improve code quality, following earlier reports that said it boosts developer productivity -- and has a retort for contrarian studies.

item.title: Visual Studio Devs Demand Claude 3.5 Sonnet AI: 'Why Is VSC Always Preferred?'
item.description: The brand-new Visual Studio 2022 v17.12 lets devs specify the AI model they want to use with the baked-in GitHub Copilot, but some are clamoring for more options, such as the latest/greatest Claude 3.5 Sonnet model from Anthropic that is available in VS Code.

item.title: SQL Database in Microsoft Fabric in Preview for Faster AI Apps
item.description: Microsoft's early embrace of advanced AI in its dev tooling continues apace with the new public preview of SQL database in Microsoft Fabric, the company's analytics/data platform.

item.title: Microsoft Seeks to Sort & Simplify its Agentic AI Dev Story
item.description: The company will infuse multi-agent runtime tech developed in its AutoGen research project into its production-ready Semantic Kernel SDK, both open source.

item.title: Uno Platform Unveils 'Hot Design' Tool for Cross-Platform .NET Apps
item.description: Uno Platform provided a new take on visual designers for .NET app development, claiming a breakthrough that changes code at runtime rather than the design stage.

item.title: Visual Studio 2022 v17.12 Ships with AI Enhancements and Streamlined Dev Tools
item.description: Microsoft just shipped Visual Studio 2022 v17.12, focusing on enhancing developer experiences specifically for .NET 9 projects and introducing new AI productivity features. This update incorporates numerous developer-requested enhancements aimed at simplifying workflows and improving overall productivity.

item.title: In .NET 9 Debut, Microsoft Focuses on .NET Aspire, AI
item.description: Microsoft shipped .NET 9 today with the dev team highlighting .NET Aspire and AI in a keynote and follow-on sessions of the livestreamed launch event.

item.title: Microsoft Intros 'Guided Chat Experience' for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio
item.description: Microsoft introduced a new guided chat experience within GitHub Copilot, aiming to make developer interactions with AI more natural and effective.

item.title: Microsoft's Open-Source Semantic Kernel AI Toolkit Extends to AWS Cloud
item.description: Microsoft announced its open-source Semantic Kernel toolkit for integrating advanced AI models into applications is now available on the Amazon Bedrock managed service.

item.title: Microsoft Previews Copilot AI in SQL Server Management Studio
item.description: In announcing SSMS 21 Preview 1 this week, Microsoft revealed Copilot AI for the tool is also being previewed, privately.

item.title: Blitz of New VS Code AI Improvements Include 'Copilot Edits'
item.description: Microsoft's October 2024 release of Visual Studio Code (v1.95) focuses on enhancing the AI-driven development experience through GitHub Copilot. AI-related updates affect large code edits, multi-account support, and a more accessible Copilot Chat.

item.title: Microsoft Previews Mads Kristensen Keynote at Orlando Dev Conference
item.description: Microsoft today previewed a keynote presentation by Visual Studio guru Mads Kristensen at an upcoming developer/IT pro event where he will be joined by other company dev luminaries such as Jon Galloway, Rachel Kang, and James Montemagno.

item.title: Syncfusion Open Sources 14 Controls for .NET MAUI
item.description: Third-party .NET-centric dev UI tooling specialist Syncfusion this week announced the open sourcing of 14 controls for .NET MAUI, the evolution of Xamarin.Forms that adds support for building desktop apps.

item.title: New Combit Reporting Tool Release Supports .NET 9
item.description: The List & Label reporting tool by combit helps devs integrate advanced reporting, printing and exporting capabilities into their apps for web, cloud and desktop environments with minimal code.

item.title: Copilot AI Enhanced in Flurry of Visual Studio v17.12 Previews
item.description: Since announcing Visual Studio 2022 v17.11 in August, Microsoft's dev team has been busy shipping a series of AI-heavy previews for the next edition.

item.title: How Visual Studio IntelliCode Helped Shape GitHub Copilot and Modern AI
item.description: Microsoft has baked advanced GitHub Copilot tech into the latest edition of Visual Studio, but the aging IntelliCode feature of the IDE actually helped shape the modern experience.

item.title: VS Code Is Latest Microsoft Dev Tooling Weaponized by Threat Actors
item.description: Cybersecurity threat actors keep leveraging Microsoft development tooling as attack vectors, with the new one coming via malware phishing.

item.title: AI Explains Expressions in Update to Java on VS Code
item.description: "The Spring Tools now show code lenses above these expressions that allow you to quickly let GitHub Copilot explain those statements for you."

item.title: Microsoft Eases Integration with Semantic Kernel AI SDK
item.description: The basic idea is to provide unified API abstractions, especially for idiomatic C# code, to help platform developers and others work with any provider with standard implementations for caching, telemetry, tool calling and other common tasks.

item.title: Final .NET 9 Preview Ships with Go-Live License
item.description: Visual Studio developers can now download the SDK for .NET 9 Release Candidate 2 with a go-live license, meaning devs get Microsoft support for production applications even before the framework reaches general availability next month.

item.title: Visual Studio's Future: Live Help to 'AI-ify Your App'
item.description: Visual Studio guru Mads Kristensen provided a peek into the IDE's AI future, explaining how while in live-coding it will identify opportunities for your own app to use AI to your advantage.

item.title: Python AI Updates Highlight New VS Code Release
item.description: Millions of Python developers using VS Code find updated data science functionality in the new release of version 1.94, the September 2024 edition of Microsoft's open-source-based editor.

item.title: Microsoft Ships Stable Versions of OpenAI Libraries for .NET and Azure
item.description: Further leveraging the relationship that vaulted Microsoft and OpenAI into leadership positions in the AI era, Microsoft this week announced stable versions of two new OpenAI libraries.

item.title: Microsoft Further Embraces OpenAPI Spec (formerly Swagger)
item.description: Microsoft has long embraced the OpenAPI Specification (formerly known as Swagger) for describing APIs, and it's now taking that support to the next level with a new online resource.

item.title: What's New for Java Tooling in VS Code, Azure Cloud
item.description: Java on Visual Studio Code gets a new tool to its extension pack, while Java on Azure upgraded the Azure Toolkit for IntelliJ and more in new regular updates for both properties.

item.title: Microsoft Highlights Third-Party Open-Source '.NET Smart Components'
item.description: Microsoft has long acknowledged third-party vendor contributions to dev tooling ecosystems like Blazor and is now doing the same for its newly open-sourced .NET Smart Components.

item.title: Data Science Pack for VS Code Bundles Python, Data and Copilot Tools
item.description: New extension pack bundles wildly popular tools for Python development, assisted by the AI-powered GitHub Copilot and a data wrangler.

item.title: 30th Annual Visual Studio Magazine Reader's Choice Awards Announced
item.description: For the 30th year in a row, Visual Studio Magazine readers have chosen the best tools and services for developers. The 2024 winners are honored in 43 categories, from component suites to testing tools to AI helpers.

item.title: Another Report Weighs In on GitHub Copilot Dev Productivity: ðŸ‘Ž
item.description: Several reports have answered "yes" to the question of whether GitHub Copilot improves developer productivity. A new one says "no."

item.title: Dev Asks, and 7 Years Later Python in VS Code Delivers Django Unit Test Support
item.description: "We are excited to announce support for one of our most requested features: you can now discover and run Django unit tests through the Test Explorer!"

item.title: OData Finally Ditches Old .NET Framework
item.description: "The most disruptive change we are making in this release is dropping support for .NET Framework."

item.title: .NET MAUI, ASP.NET Core Polished in First Release Candidate for .NET 9
item.description: Microsoft shipped the first release candidate for .NET 9, which is nearing feature completeness and production readiness in advance of its November debut.

item.title: Microsoft's Stalled UWP Project Supports .NET 9 to Help WinUI 3 Migration
item.description: The company urges devs to switch to Windows App SDK and WinUI 3 because UWP is no longer under active development.

item.title: VS Code Experiments Boost AI Copilot Functionality
item.description: Devs can now customize code generation, enjoy enhanced Chat experiences and much more.

item.title: Windows Community Toolkit Update Improves Controls
item.description: The Windows Community Toolkit advanced to version 8.1, adding new features, improving existing controls and making dependency changes.

item.title: ASP.NET Core, .NET MAUI Updated as .NET 9 Nears
item.description: The web-dev ASP.NET Core framework and Xamarin.Forms' successor .NET MAUI received the lion's share of dev attention in the seventh preview of .NET 9 as Microsoft preps for a November launch at .NET Conf 2024.

item.title: .NET Community Toolkit Gets Native AOT and .NET 8 Support
item.description: The .NET Community Toolkit is Microsoft's latest dev tooling to get native ahead-of-time compilation, continuing a years-long push for that capability across the board.

item.title: GitHub Copilot Tops Research Report on AI Code Assistants
item.description: GitHub topped research firm's Gartner's inaugural Magic Quadrant report on AI code assistants, with Copilot leading in both completeness of vision and ability to execute.

item.title: VS Code Tool for Azure Machine Learning Ships After 7-Year Preview
item.description: "You can use your favorite VS Code setup, either desktop or web, to build, train, deploy, debug, and manage machine learning models with Azure Machine Learning from within VS Code."

item.title: Newly Open-Sourced '.NET Smart Components' Demoed at AI Event
item.description: Yesterday's .NET Conf Focus on AI online event highlighted Microsoft's latest/greatest AI dev tooling, including the newly open-sourced .NET Smart Components.

item.title: Content Exclusion Is Latest of Many New Visual Studio Copilot Features
item.description: The ability for admins to configure Copilot to ignore specific files in repositories or organizations joins a raft of other enhancements that affect everything from commit histories to pull requests to targeted slash commands and more.

item.title: Microsoft Spotlights .NET 9, Cloud in First Visual Studio 2022 v17.12 Preview
item.description: With Visual Studio 2022 v17.11 shipping this week, the first preview of the next edition sees Microsoft emphasizing support for the coming .NET 9 and cloud development with Aspire.

item.title: Visual Studio 2022 v17.11 Ships 'Shaped by Your Feedback' (and AI)
item.description: Microsoft's Mads Kristensen heavily emphasized the community contributions that helped the dev team ship the brand-new Visual Studio 2022 version 17.11, which includes new features, improvements and fixes across the board spawned from the ideas of users.

item.title: VSLive! Dev Conference Tip Leads to New IDE Extension: Sql Formatter
item.description: "During the VS Live conference last week, it was brought to my attention that Visual Studio has no support for formatting SQL files."

item.title: Copilot Rolled Out to Your Org? Better Check User Activity
item.description: Many organizations jumped on the Gen AI bandwagon in a big way, but now that it has fallen into the "trough of disillusionment," it might be time to check copilot usage to control costs, check for inappropriate or risky behavior and so on.

item.title: VS Code v1.92: Pick Your Browser, Use OpenAI's GPT-4o AI Model
item.description: A highlight of the latest release of Microsoft's Visual Studio Code open-source-based code editor is the ability to pick your default browser for opening links, along with access to new advanced AI model.

item.title: ABP Ships Community Edition of Open Source .NET Dev Framework
item.description: Flying under the radar below Visual Studio, VS Code, JetBrains Rider and other big names in the .NET-centric IDE space is the open-source ABP, which just shipped a new community edition.

item.title: With .NET 6 Support Ending, Security Vulnerabilities Loom
item.description: While many Visual Studio developers are awaiting the debut of .NET 9 in November, they might want to pay attention to a looming security issue with .NET 6, which will reach end of support at the same time, perhaps leaving apps open to cybersecurity attacks.

item.title: Semantic Kernel AI SDK Gets Autonomous Agents (Experimental)
item.description: As AI matures, agents are one of the most significant areas of development, and Microsoft's Semantic Kernel AI dev tooling is getting them, as an experiment for now.

item.title: 'GitHub Models' AI Playground Debuts with Llama 3.1, GPT-4o and More
item.description: GitHub Models is unveiled as a limited public beta to help platform's 100-million-plus developers try out the latest/greatest AI models from a range of providers.

item.title: Java, Python Tooling Advances in VS Code
item.description: Microsoft's Visual Studio Code dev teams for Java and Python announced Gradle enhancements for the former and improved Python discovery for the latter.

item.title: Copilot in Visual Studio Will Get Access to Org Knowledge Bases
item.description: Visual Studio devs who have become dependent upon GitHub Copilot AI assistance will have to wait a while for a hot new feature already available in VS Code.

item.title: Microsoft Going Small in Semantic Kernel AI Dev Tooling
item.description: In revealing future plans for its Semantic Kernel AI dev tooling, Microsoft said it's going small -- at lease in terms of AI model size.

item.title: Microsoft Previews AI Prompt Playground for VS Code: Prompty
item.description: Prompt engineering positions might not be pulling down $335,000 salaries anymore, but Microsoft is continuing to pump out AI model prompting guidance, with a recent effort being Prompty, described as an intuitive prompt playground delivered in a Visual Studio Code extension.
